item.title: [GEN-576] Problem when sharing the recorded video
item.description:
VK-502 (nurse → Linda Day)

Linda: “I was trying to play the video for the Mom to see. I exited, refreshed, reloaded, and tried to replay, however, it would not play past 1-2 min. I tried to pull the video forward manually but it would not play.”

Apparently, Linda said she opened the video later on and it was okay
item.summary: Problem when sharing the recorded video

item.title: [GEN-575] Server error when logging in
item.description:
Scenario:

  1. When adding a user for the first time, a temporary password will be sent to the user. If the user misses the temporary password and clicks on forgot password, another email will be sent to them including a code.
  2. The user can set a new password using the code received and will be redirected to the login page

Bug:

After inserting the correct username and password, the system asks the user to set a new password [again!]. However, if the user inserts a password, the system will show them a 'server error'.

In addition, ‘server error’ has happened for one of the parents (VK-513)
item.summary: Server error when logging in

item.title: [GEN-554] Next session info is not shown correctly in a few cases
item.description:
When joining a session, the date and time of the next session will be shown on the top right of the screen.

  1. Assume that sessions 1 to 4 are scheduled. We are in the 2nd session and the 3rd session is cancelled. the system will show the date and time of the third session as the next session.
  2. assume that we are in session 4. and session 5 is not scheduled but session 6 and 9 are scheduled. the system shows the date and time of the 9th session as the next session
item.summary: Next session info is not shown correctly in a few cases

item.title: [GEN-525] Some terminologies should be changed
item.description:
The following terminologies should be changed:

  • Change ‘Baby' to 'Child’ (even in the add caregiver form)
  • Change ‘Visit' to 'Session’ (Manage Staff Table (Next visit → Next Session)
  • Change ‘Resources' tab to 'Session Tools’
  • Edit Caregiver → Co-parent info → ‘Relationship to Mother' should be changed to 'Relationship to Caregiver’
  • ToolBar (Left): baby carriage should be replaced with stick figures of a parent with her child
  • Charting: Change home integrity tool to ‘home integrity checklist’ (check box to indicate sessions completed)
item.summary: Some terminologies should be changed

item.title: [GEN-365] Peer Evaluation
item.description:
1. Each team has a certain amount of time to discuss and team members can submit their answers individually (e.g. 2 minutes for a question)
  2. When all the members of a team submitted their answers the answers will be revealed (but anonymous) (e.g. the students can see 2 people chose option 2 but no one knows who chose it)
  3. One of the team members should submit the final decision after the discussion
item.summary: Peer Evaluation

item.title: [GEN-361] Taking a quiz by the student (answering the questions individually)
item.description:
Part 1: Answer the questions individually:

  1. Each student have a certain amount of time to answer some individual questions (e.g. 20 minutes for 15 tests)
  2. The student can go back and forth among the questions in a defined period
  3. The students can change their answer in a defined period
  4. The students should submit all the answers altogether and then go to the next part of the quiz (If the allotted time expires, the answers will be submitted automatically)

Part 2: Peer reviewing (https://aranite.atlassian.net/browse/GEN-365?atlOrigin=eyJpIjoiZWRkNzJkYzE4Y2EwNDIyYzg2ZGUyYTI3ODcwYzViZWEiLCJwIjoiaiJ9)
item.summary: Taking a quiz by the student (answering the questions individually)

item.title: [GEN-356] Courses (student)
item.description:
The Student can:

  • See the list of the courses:
    • By semester
    • Number of the quizzes for the course
    • Student’s progress in the course
  • For more info, the student can click on each course to see more details about each course including the headlines, quizzes and etc.
  • Students can be able to have multiple courses
item.summary: Courses (student)

item.title: [GEN-355] Showing the quiz information (Student)
item.description:
The students can see the list of the quizzes in two ways:

  • List of the upcoming quizzes in the dashboard (including course name and module information)
  • The students can see the list of all the quizzes (active or inactive) under each course information

If the quiz is active, the students can take the quiz (https://aranite.atlassian.net/browse/GEN-361?atlOrigin=eyJpIjoiZWYyMGFlMzljZGVhNDViYTgwNTFhMTlhOTJhOWE5MzUiLCJwIjoiaiJ9 )
item.summary: Showing the quiz information (Student)

comments.comment: Lacks details. This is also another HUGE epic. Should be split into smaller well-defined epics.

item.title: [GEN-354] Classes (Instructor)
item.description:
The Instructors can:

  • See the list of the courses:
    • By semester
    • Edit or Delete the course
    • Number of the quizzes for each course
      • Add or delete quizzes
    • Student’s progress in the course
  • For more info, the Instructor can click on each course to see more details about each course including the headlines, quizzes and etc and edit or delete a course:
    • Editing the start time and end time of a course
    • Title of a course
  • Instructors can be able to have multiple courses
item.summary: Classes (Instructor)

item.title: [GEN-353] Showing the quiz information to the instructor
item.description:
The quizzes are split into three types(tables):

  • Active Quizzes
  • Completed quizzes (Due deadline is passed)
  • Draft Quizzes (Quizzes that are in the designing process)

The instructor should be able to edit an existing quiz or design a new quiz for a course (https://aranite.atlassian.net/browse/GEN-359?atlOrigin=eyJpIjoiZDVjY2FkMmQ4ZjI3NDA5Zjg4YWMxNzI2ODk4NWYxODQiLCJwIjoiaiJ9 )

Each course consists of multiple quizzes

Also, the instructor should be able to see the results of the quizzes (https://aranite.atlassian.net/browse/GEN-360?atlOrigin=eyJpIjoiNjVmODk4MzcxNmMxNDFjMmFkNjI4ZWE1NjAzMjdhYjkiLCJwIjoiaiJ9 )
item.summary: Showing the quiz information to the instructor

comments.comment: Discuss with Dr. Moshirpour and the client on this. There should be a concept of “module” in here as well.
Also, this is a HUGE epic. Should be split into smaller well defined epics.

item.title: [GEN-352] Instructor's dashboard
item.description: The instructors can see the list of the active courses and quizzes in their dashboard.
item.summary: Instructor's dashboard

comments.comment: In my opinion, in terms of showing the list of the past courses and quizzes, I think it shouldn’t be shown in the instructor’s dashboard (only active courses and quizzes would be okay).

item.title: [GEN-350] Student's dashboard
item.description: Students can see the list of the upcoming/active quizzes, and courses. Also, the list of the past/inactive courses and quizzes should be visible to the students.
item.summary: Student's dashboard

comments.comment:
The client has not asked for calendar for students.

The students should be able to distinguish between upcomming/active coures and quizes and past/inactive quizes.
In my opinion, in terms of showing the list of the past courses and quizzes, I think it shouldn’t be shown in the student dashboard (only active courses and quizzes would be okay).

item.title: [GEN-349] As a user, I want to be able to recover my password when forgot
item.description:
1. A Forgot Password link should be added to the log-in page.
  2. Another page should be opened to get the user’s email address.
  3. An email should be sent to the user including a link to set a new password

comments.comment: Since we’ll be using OAuth, this should not be necessary.

item.title: [GEN-348] As a new user, I want to be able to sign up
item.description:
A link should be added to the login page that redirects the user to the sign-up page.

Sign up requirements:

  • Email (The email format should be valid)
  • Password (The password should have the least complexity)
  • Confirm Password

After entering the following information the system should redirect the user to the next step where the users should insert the code that is emailed to them. (verifying the email address)
item.summary: As a new user, I want to be able to sign up

comments.comment:
Users sign up using UofC OAuth.

Also, the signup process starts by instructors sharing a unique link to their class.

  • Password
item.summary: As a user, I want to login with username and password

item.title: [GEN-184] Email format modifications
item.description:
Please make the below changes to emails sent to parents after scheduling visits/sessions:

Remove the space between parent name and the comma after. It's like "Dear ParentName ," now. Make it like "Dear ParentName,".

Add an "@" before visit time and add AM/PM after it.
Add a comma after the day of the month and the weekday.
[ ] Mention the visit/session number.
It should match the following example: "Your 3rd VID-KIDS Virtual visit is scheduled for Friday, June 4th, 2021 @ 2:36 PM".

Replace "please contact us at vidkids@ucalgary.ca" with "please contact your nurse" for VIDKIDS or "please contact your facilitator" for ATTACH.

Please make the below modification to emails sent to nurses/facilitators after scheduling visits/sessions:

Mention the parent's name with whom the nurse/facilitator has scheduled the visit/session like below:
[ ] Your next VID-KIDS Virtual visit with ParentName is scheduled for Friday, June 4th, 2021 @ 2:36 PM.
item.summary: Email format modifications

comments.comment: For new schedule

There should be a comma after the day of the month like: June 4th, 2021. Visit is currently written as VISIT_# in the email, I think it should be written as 3rd visit, 4th visit, etc.

Ali Salmani

item.title: [GEN-158] Study Case id is not unique for each parent.
item.description: For example: try searching for VK-299 in the develop branch. You will notice that three parents have the same study case with the same meeting, meaning changing one of the meeting's time, for example, will change all three. The entire assignment process breaks, the nurse that clicks assigns to me will block control of another nurse on a case having the same study case id.
item.summary: Study Case id is not unique for each parent.

comments.comment: Ahmed Abdullah How can this be reproduced?
Search for visit number VK-299 or VK-003 or VK-261 or VK-16 or any repeated id in the develop branch, then add a visit to any one of them, the visit will be added to all rows. Arash
I think I figured it out, we are not setting the state of the study cases to ‘ASSIGNED’ after assigning them which causes them to be reused in later assignments.

Awesome, nice find!

This comment was left via Slack.

Note for the tester:
You will still find repeated study IDs due to the fact that we did not delete them in our database. To test, please make a query for study cases with the state: “ASSIGNED” and then assign a parent to you. Rerun the query and the Study ID assigned for the user should be added to the list of study cases with a state of “ASSIGNED”. You can try another equivalent method, this is just what I used

item.title: [GEN-131] Visit creation at the same date and time returned error but executed
item.description:
Function being tested

Visit Creation

The initial state of the system

The nurse has logged in and is exploring the parents' directory

Steps to reproduce report/bug

  1. Log in as a nurse
  2. Create a visit at a specific date and time
  3. Create another visit at the same time

Expected outcome

An error pops up and the second visit doesn't get created

Actual outcome

The error popped up but the second visit created at the same time as the first visit.
item.summary: Visit creation at the same date and time returned error but executed

comments.comment: Alireza ImaniHow long is acceptable between two meeting?
I should ask nurses about it.
Take 1 hour between tasks.

With different time

same time

show correct message

Here is a spreadsheet of the tests I ran on the develop branch: https://docs.google.com/spreadsheets/d/1Nj5iQzdkxkm1-STmSay79MWgWuVDq-weK2nsOjoUZn8/edit?usp=sharing . They were manually tested one by one.

Test #3 is the issue described here. This has been solved. I ran further tests to see if I can find other errors.

Note that the ones that “failed” may not be considered a fail since those features have most likely not been implemented yet. Feel free to ignore those if they aren’t the expected outputs.

item.title: [GEN-16] During call, update the next visit date
item.description:
Hey Ahmed Abdullah just making sure that you know the requirements:

During a video call, the nurse can click on the schedule button and schedule or reschedule the next meeting. When that happens, the text in the upper right of the page should show the updated schedule witohut needing to refresh the page.
item.summary: During call, update the next visit date

comments.comment: So it seems like the functionality was already implemented in the code, it had a small bug in the graphql queries, however. The study cases' corrupted data in the database still throw errors when creating a new visit but the visit is updated anyways. Arash
We should make sure to fix that bug next. Please bring it up in the planning meeting if I forget

item.title: [GEN-12] Restrict access to videos
item.description:
• POC only
    • Test the two approaches suggested by AWS
      • 1: Presigned URLs to “custom” directory
      • 2: Using “private/protected” directories with user “sub” values + changing jitsi to obtain more info about user and environment
  • Only STAFF can access the videos stored on the s3 bucket
  • All authenticated users can access the profile pictures stored on S3
item.summary: Restrict access to videos
